page.title: 12LOCAL DIALECT
page.content: In recent years increased social mobility & the mass media have done much to dilute the local dialect of the area.However many words are still in common use amongst older & local residents.eg.Addle(earn),Aye(yes),Beck (stream),Buttery bush(elderberry), Brossen(full after eating),Claggy (sticky),Clemmies(stones),Cuddy fisted (left handed),Dowly(in poor condition) Ginnel(narrow passage),Gully(knife), Lakin(playing),Lowance(tea break),Lowp (jump),Mafted(too warm),Mawk(maggot), Mizzling(raining lightly),Nivver(no), Nowt(nothing),Parky(cold),Shav(sheaf), Slape(slippy),Spitting with rain (raining lightly),Snagger(implement for harvesting turnips),Snicket(narrow passage),Summat(something),Thoo(you), Tup(male sheep),T'oss(the horse),Yan (one),Yon(that there),Yonder(over there),Yow(ewe).
